attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Put Dropped Kerbs REQUIRED in Law into the Highways Acts, At this time it is Not
attributes.background: A number today just do their own thing on the Highways causing Areas to look Run Down, All Properties that want a Drive ‘Must Have A Dropped Kerb’ and a Tarmac Area to their Boundary, this would keep things in Order and Controlled, some put items in the gutter to get over it, Dangerous to Cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Property Owners Churn Up the Grass Verges causing issues with Mud Displacement onto Footpaths which the Council has to Clean Up st Cost, if it was Law to have a Dropped Kerb none of these issues would arise, believe anyone doing so can Get Blocked in as there is No drive in Law, if Written into the Highways Acts would clean up the Highways in General, also stop these putting things into the gutters to get over the Kerbs and keep them free from any Obstruction.

Should be common sense.

attributes.action: Remove stamp duty for First Time Buyers by making sellers pay the tax
attributes.background:
Stamp Duty is a prohibitive tax to home ownership. 
First time buyers need help and will struggle to find the deposit as the UK is suffering a massive shortfall in homes. 
Most sellers have large  equity gains & removing the need for them to pay on their purchase, will allow the cost to be offset
attributes.additional_details:
By allowing this change, the whole market will benefit from movement as chains are completed by those hitherto unable to make the duty plus deposit.

Those downsizing and coming out of the market would have to pay more but they sit on the largest profits anyway  

First-time buyers in the UK could save an average of £3,625, while Londoners could save £13,171, if the tax burden was shifted to sellers.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-39139128

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Make illegal all cold calling telemarketing calls to UK phone numbers
attributes.background:
Almost all British Citizens have mobile phones near us at all times, and increasingly less control over who has our phone number

Unscrupulous companies call without prior permission, at any time of day or night, in order to sell us unwanted products or services. This behaviour should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details:
Telemarketing has existed in for almost as long as there have been telephones. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing

In 2017, 94% of UK adults owned at least one mobile, and there were 26.4m landlines in the UK. Ofcom: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/facts

In 2014, 58% of surveyed companies used telemarketing to generate customer sales. dma.org: https://dma.org.uk/press-release/new-telemarketing-research-reveals-it-s-good-to-talk

In 2013, 85% of householders said they'd received a nuisance call on their landline, 17% complained. thisismoney.co.uk: http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-2377639/Watchdog-launches-online-tool-reporting-nuisance-calls-texts.html

attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: Include the Welsh dragon onto the Union Jack.
attributes.background: For centuries Wales has been brutally ignored from our nation's flag. We with a voice must feel empowered to speak up against this disgrace. In November 2007 the House of Commons discussed this however no follow up action has been executed. We must take action and be proud of our heritage!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-25222891 Here is a fantastic list of examples of how the UK should represent the beautiful country of Wales. 
IMG_7543.JPG

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Sign and Ratify the Treaty for the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons
attributes.background:
On 7 July 2017, 122 governments voted at the UN to adopt the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons. Nuclear weapons have now been categorically rejected by the international community.

“The world is over-armed and peace is under-funded …." United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon
attributes.additional_details:
The new Treaty puts nuclear weapons on the same legal footing as  biological weapons, chemical weapons, anti-personnel landmines and cluster munitions.

http://www.icanw.org/the-facts/catastrophic-harm/a-diversion-of-public-resources/

https://www.nuclearinfo.org/article/transport/foi-records-reveal-nuclear-warhead-convoy-safety-faults

http://www.icanw.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/WEBhumanitarianrisks.pdf

attributes.action: Make Financial Studies a core subject on the National Curriculum at Key Stage 4
attributes.background: Sometimes we all question some of the things we had to learn at school, like pi or algebra, and how they have had no relevance in our lives at all. Some of us may have achieved an A* in our English Literature exam, but Shakespeare will never help you understand how to get a mortgage or manage debt.
attributes.additional_details: Debt and money issues are a rising concern for young people in the UK, with those aged 16 to 24 having the highest individual debt to income ratio amongst all over age groups (Household debt inequalities dataset, ONS, April 2016). School should be preparing our children for the real world, and I call on the UK Government to make financial studies a core subject in our National Curriculum, so that our children can leave school with the best chances of being financially stable and debt free.

attributes.action: Charge all Foreign Vehicles entering the UK
attributes.background: All Foreign Vehicles entering the UK to use our roads and motorways, to be charged a one year payment, and be issued a Vignette to register for their use of our road system.
attributes.additional_details:
If most of Europe can charge for their roads, it should be done in the UK, to help our economy, by extra revenue for maintaining our road infrastructure.
As an Island Nation we have the ideal opportunity, to charge at all Ports of entry.

attributes.action: reduce the brightness of vehicle emergency blue lights by half at night.
attributes.background: As a driver who works nights , I am regularly blinded by emergency vehicles using blue flashing lights. This causes a severe risk to other road users as my vehicle is a hgv that would cause mayhem if I lost control due to being blinded by these lights.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Make the questions on PIP forms more suitable for mental health sufferers.
attributes.background:
Recently many people have had their Personal independence payment stopped and are no longer meeting the criteria. 
 From experience i think the questions are more aimed at people with physical disabilities and mental retardations rather than mental health issues.
attributes.additional_details:
Questions such as how far can you walk?
Can you prepare food?
Can you wash yourself?
To make the forms more suitable for people suffering with severe mental health issues they need to be asking questions such as...
1. How is your sleep effected?
2. How do you feel when you go outside?
3. Do you have times when you neglect your hygiene?
4. Have you ever had addiction problems?
5. How are you at handling your finances?
6. How is your memory?
7. How often do you experience a symptom? Ect ect...

attributes.action: Increase the Speed Limit on motorways between 11pm and 6am to 80 mph for cars.
attributes.background: During the night the motorway network is used less. Vehicles are now much better equipped with safety features to travel faster. Increasing the speed limit at night will encourage more travelling at this time and less congestion during the day. It would promote quicker and safer travelling at night.
attributes.additional_details: The National Speed Limit of 70mph on motorways was first introduced on a trial basis in 1965 and became permanent in 1967. The current 70mph limit has now been in place for over 50 years.

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and that’s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.

attributes.action: Set up an online registry for living organ donation
attributes.background: I recently called my regional transplant centre to donate a kidney and found that the process of ringing and finding information about living donation daunting and difficult. An online living donor registry with a pre-screening process could help encourage others to come forward and also save time.
attributes.additional_details:
I was told that it was unlikely to be able to due to being a young female (risks of renal failure during future pregnancy). A online registry with sufficient information could therefore save time as the medical professional had to explain the reasoning to me whilst simultaneously ensuring only those eligible come forward. 
From my perspective, there isn't enough education and awareness surrounding this topic and promoting living donation more may significantly help the many people in need

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have sprinklers in all schools in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Childrens lives are being put at risk because new schools or refurbished school since 2014 do not have to have sprinklers fitted
In Scotland and Wales it is mandatory so it should be the same for English and Northern Irish schools
attributes.additional_details:
The National Fire Chiefs Council believe all schools should be fitted as seen in this BBC article dated 25 October 2017
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41744582
The DfE's "expectation that all new schools will have sprinklers fitted", unless a school is "low risk" and installation "would not be good value for money".
Despite this, less than a third of the 260 schools built since 2014 under the Schools Building Programme have sprinklers

attributes.action: Nationalise the national lottery run by Camelot.
attributes.background:
All profits should go to NHS and schools etc.
It is a licence to print money so why  should a foreign company profit from a state run franchise.
attributes.additional_details: why shouldn't all profits go to bus or schools.

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action: Make Northumberland Scottish land
attributes.background: I think that Scotland should rightfully own Northumberland. This is because Northumberland and Scotland share a similar culture and have strong ethnic ties. I believe this may help with the economy and natural resources as Northumberland has a lot of coal.
attributes.additional_details: Back in 2014/2015 many petitions were made for Northumberland to once again join Scotland. Many news articles reported on this. However, the people who signed those petitions did not get their wish. We have a shared history and culture. The UK Government in London doesn't govern Northumberland very well.

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: Amend building regulations to ban use of wooden/ laminate flooring in flats.
attributes.background:
Wooden and laminate floors in non-ground floor flats can make life very difficult for people living in flats below. The noise can be unbearable. 

Building regulations should be amended to ban the use of such flooring in non-ground floor flats.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Legislate to ban fast food delivery riders from working without a full license.
attributes.background: Fast food delivery riders are under pressure to deliver as soon as possible, in some cases they have a set time, or lose money.  They can get on a moped with no training or experience.  All that is required is a provisional licence and a set of ‘l plates’.
attributes.additional_details: Riders can be seen throughout the UK weaving  and zigzagging through traffic, overtaking and squeezing through almost impossible spaces, in a kamikaze like attempt to deliver and get back to base and be on the road again. This gets worse when other delivery riders are near.  Intense rivalry between companies and even colleagues makes for dangerous situations.

attributes.action: Clothing shops to have full disabled access and disabled changing facilities
attributes.background: Many stores in the UK don’t have disabiled access and unsutiable changing facilities for people with disabilities. I would like the government to introduce legislation that would make it compulsory for all clothing stores to have disabled changing facilities.

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Parliament to not debate holding an second brexit referendum
attributes.background: In 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU by 17 million votes. Parliament to debate holding another vote would be against an Democratic vote.

attributes.action: Call on Boris Johnson to apologise immediately to Libya
attributes.background: Boris Johnson, the UK’s foreign secretary, is yet again finding himself in troubled water after making arguably racist remarks about another country. The fact that a foreign secretary can do this is baffling. He must apologise immediately - his views are NOT echoed by the UK people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-politics-41490174

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.

attributes.action: Lower Import duty on classic car parts from the USA.
attributes.background: Many small car/garage businesses in the UK rely on classic car parts and associated services from the USA but many struggle financially  due to the amount of duty paid. We ask Parliament to either abolish it on classic car parts or lower it to a reasonable level, with clear rules on its application
attributes.additional_details: There have been numberous instances where we have sent car parts for engineering work in the USA having already imported it from the USA only to be charged import duty again on the parts return to the UK. The rules are evidently either unfair or unclear to those applying them. Your urgent attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Abolish taxation on voluntary tips for good service.
attributes.background: A tip is a voluntary gift from a person being served to a server and as such should be given tax exempt status. As many people who rely on tips are students, in between jobs or in low income families this would help ease ever increasing money burdens and possibly even stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for immigration to the UK like Australia based on work skills
attributes.background: To enter Austrailia to live you must apply and are considered based on the contribution you can make to the country. Each applicant should be able and expected to work and priority is given to applicants who are qualified in emplyment areas which we are lacking applicants

attributes.action: Continue the "Retained right of residence" for former Spouse of  EEA nationals
attributes.background:
Under Current EEA regulations, former spouses of EEA nationals, retain their right to reside in the UK, even after they cease to be family members of an EEA national.
.
attributes.additional_details: This is a vital protection, as this covers former spouses who have been the victims of domestic voilence and other vulnerable people. Furthermore, people who retain their right of residence, are living in the UK by the virtue of EEA law, and so it is only fair that these people are also covered by the brexit negotiations and the protections afforded to EEA nationals are also extended to those people who retain their right of residence

attributes.action: Include under 25s in the National Living Wage & adopt the real living wage.
attributes.background:
The Govt's National Living Wage is currently set at £7.50/hr for people aged 25 & over. However this doesn't apply to under 25s, some of whom can be on wages as low as £5.60/hr. We call on the Govt to:
- Include under 25s
- Adopt the real living wage (£10.20 in London, £8.75 in the rest of the UK)
attributes.additional_details: As the Living Wage Week comes to end, we believe that workers in Britain deserve a proper wage rise. With the Chancellor preparing to announce his first budget of this Parliament, we must put pressure on the Govt to adopt the real living wage released by the Living Wage Foundation. A report released by KPMG highlighted that 5.5 million people still earn less than the real Living Wage rates. If you believe that all workers deserve a fair day’s pay for a fair day’s work, please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Only allow fireworks on Firework night and New Years Eve due to pets rights.
attributes.background: I believe it is wrong that fireworks are released for days before and days after both Fireworks night and New Years Eve. This can scare pets and cause them to be unable to move from a position or relieve themselves outside. This is against their rights under the five freedoms, so should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: This can also cause animals to run away from owners, or bolt when on walks, and so can leave owners devastated, and can lead to deaths and injuries to these animals. This can cause both emotional, physical and financial damage to the owners and public, along with emotional and physical damage to pets.

attributes.action: Ban the use of lead in all shotgun cartridges
attributes.background: The lead in shotgun cartridges is poisoning our environment. This leads to the slow death of many species of birds. Albeit shot birds that are consumed by predatory birds and scavengers or birds ingesting them mistakenly taken as grit. There are many alternatives available to use.

attributes.action: Stop child maintenance payments being calculated before tax, calculate after!
attributes.background: We currently calculate child maintenance on the paying parents income before tax based in income they do not have but rather 20-40% less. Many parents are left unable to live and go to lengths such as suicide. Yes pay for your child but it has to be fair. Also children within their home suffer too.
attributes.additional_details:
Calculations are based off of money you don't have ie you have a gross income of £3300 per month (which cms will use to calculate) however you're actually getting £2600 net income. A huge £700 difference. 
A child you pay for is worth £300 a month yet the children in your own home are work £10 a month each!
People have committed suicide due to cms calculations and pushing them.

attributes.action: Parents/carers of bullies should face jail time and/or a fine.
attributes.background: Children's suicide levels in the UK are on the rise and this is a direct result from being bullied. Bullying is a rampant problem in schools all across the UK, parents/carers need to take more responsibility for the actions of those in their care.
attributes.additional_details: In certain towns such as North Tonawand, New York have introduced laws where parents of bullies face a potential 15 days in prison or a $250 (£190) fine. The UK needs to follow suit in an attempt to resolve the ongoing problem that is bullying.

attributes.action: Give equal state pension to every state pensioner
attributes.background: Back in April 2016 the government introduced a new state pension of £155/week for state pensioners but if you were already a state pensioner i.e. pre April 2016 your state pension remained the same £125 per week surely this cannot be fair or just why should any state pensioner get £30 a week more.
attributes.additional_details: I am very vexed about this scenario if we were talking of a few pence but this is serious money approx. £30 per week or £120 per month I feel the government has created a two tier pension scheme one for rich state pensioners post April 2016 and one for poor state pensioners pre April 2016 I feel this is totally unfair as I am on the pre 2016 rate after having paid in over 38 years of national insurance contributions why should I receive less money per month than a "new pensioner".

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Nurses to work without having to pay an annual registration £120 fee to the NMC
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to support nurses not having to pay an annual registration fee to the NMC which is very costly . Nurses should be able to register without having to pay any fees .
